turn.0: Eli5: Why is an afro unprofessional in corporate workplaces?
turn.1: Some are and some aren't.  Typically the ones less open to a casual hairstyle are the more "professional" (e.g., law firm, banking) while "blue collar" (e.g., construction) are more accepting as long as it does not interfere with safety.  A number of offices have become much more casual over the past year so hairstyles vary.  Some retail are open, but some are also trying to have a consistent look to their employees to match the store (think A&F, or Bath & Body Works)
turn.2: But why do you think it isn't as acceptable for lawyers, bankers, etc? Do you think it'll ever be majorly acceptable for them?
turn.3: I think there is a strong sense of what they feel is professionalism - if you dress in an expensive suit and have your hair perfectly manicured it tells everyone "look how successful I am.c"  not tht I agree with it, but that is the general sense I have gotten over the years.
turn.4: But why hasn't the professionalism norm changed much
turn.5: Good question.  From my understanding it has been that way since those professions began.  Probably a good doctoral thesis for a sociologist!
